djangotailoring.views.tailoring¶

Views¶

The view classes are divided into a pair of base classes, and a pair of classes inheriting from the base with enough functionality to be used on their own.

Base Views¶

class djangotailoring.views.tailoring.BaseMultipleTailoredDocView¶

As a subclass of TemplateView, it renders a django template with multiple tailoring documents accessible in the template context. There are two required attributes to make this view function:

message_documents¶

A dictionary-like object that builds at mapping of template context names to message document paths. For instance, if it is a dict of:

{'treq1': 'Messages/Welcome.messages', 'treq2': 'Messages/Header.messages'},

The template context would have two variables treq1 and treq2 that reference the tailoring requests for the associated documents. The default is an empty dictionary.

template_name¶

A string, or list of strings, that identify the template to render on request. The default is None.

All methods of django.views.generic.TemplateView are available. When overriding, be sure to call the super method. In addition, there are three more methods that may be overridden:

get_subject(self)¶
Return type:tailoring2.Subject

A method to override (generally by mixin) that returns a subject based on the active request. By default, it returns None. Implementors should override this method.

get_message_documents(self)¶
Return type:dictionary of context_name strings to document paths

Override this method to customize the dictionary of message doc paths that is used for rendering in the format for the message_documents. By default, it returns self.message_documents

get_tailoring_request(self, doc)¶
Parameters:doc – message document path
Return type:djangotailoring.TailoringRequest for the current subject and doc
class djangotailoring.views.tailoring.BaseTailoredDocView¶

A subclass of BaseMultipleTailoredDocView. Its purpose is to simplify the one Message document, one template scenario. Instead of using the BaseMultipleTailoredDocView.message_documents attribute and associated method, use the message_document attribute and associated method to define the functionality. It is functionally equivalent to defining a BaseMultipleTailoredDocView with message_documents set to:

{self.context_treq_name: self.get_message_document()}
message_document¶

A path to a message document. The path may be relative to the project or absolute.

context_treq_name¶

A string. This is the variable name that will be used for the generated TailoringRequest.

As with BaseMultipleTailoredDocView, you may override the following method to customize the rendering behavior:

get_message_document(self)¶

Customize the path to the message document to tailor based upon any additional information. By default, it returns self.message_document.

Public Views¶

class djangotailoring.views.tailoring.TailoredDocView¶

Blends BaseTailoredDocView with UserProfileSubjectMixin to make a turn-key tailoring view. It requires the same attributes/overrides as BaseTailoredDocView.

class djangotailoring.views.tailoring.MultipleTailoredDocView¶

Blends BaseMultipleTailoredDocView with UserProfileSubjectMixin to make a turn-key mutli-document tailoring view. It requires the same attributes/overrides as BaseMultipleTailoredDocView.

Mixins¶

class djangotailoring.views.tailoring.UserProfileSubjectMixin¶

A tailoring view mixin class that provides a get_subject() implementation which returns a Subject instance return by the logged-in user’s UserProfile.tailoringsubject attribute. In addition, it provides a few additional methods for access to certain fields of the user’s profile.

get_subject(self)¶
Return type:tailoring2.Subject

Returns the request.user’s tailoring Subject instance.

get_profile(self)¶
Return type:a djangotailoring.userprofile.BaseUserProfile instance

A shortcut to get the user profile of the current request user.

get_user_id(self)¶
Return type:a String

A shortcut to the tailoring id of the request user.

save_subject(self, subject)¶
Parameters:subject – a tailoring2.Subject instance

Stores the subject data using the request user’s profile’ subject loader.
